weather.description: Hot and dry summer days with strong Patagonian winds and long daylight hours, ideal for beach and wildlife visits.
Still warm and dry with conditions similar to January, remaining one of the best months to visit.
Temperatures begin to ease into a pleasant autumn, with comfortable conditions and low rainfall.
Cooler autumn weather sets in with occasional showers and noticeably shorter days.
Cool and sometimes windy with light rain; southern right whales begin arriving in the region.
Cold winter conditions with frequent wind and overcast skies; whale watching season is underway.
The coldest month with strong winds and occasional frost; peak whale watching season draws visitors despite the chill.
Still cold but whale activity remains high, making it a rewarding month for wildlife enthusiasts.
Early spring brings slightly warmer days and continued whale sightings as the season winds down.
Spring warms up with more sunshine; elephant seals and penguins become the main wildlife attraction.
Warm and increasingly sunny with excellent conditions for visiting Punta Tombo penguin colony.
Hot summer days return with long evenings and low rainfall, great for outdoor and coastal activities.
